item.title: Reasoning over Health Records with Vadalog: a Rule-based Approach to Patient Pathways
item.description: ðŸ‘¥ Owen P. Dwyer, Teodoro Baldazzi, Jim Davies, Emanuel Sallinger and Adriano Vlad ðŸ“• 17th International Rule Challenge @ RuleML+RR 2023 In recent years, the scale of biomedical and healthcare data has grown exponentially, leading to companies building large enterprise knowledge graphs as well as scalable and intelligent processing systems to exploit them. In this high-stakes domain, the transparency of data-driven processes is paramount to ensure high levels of trustworthiness and accountability for patient safety.

item.title: Profiling IoT-based Botnet Traffic using DNS
item.description: ðŸ‘¥ Owen P. Dwyer, Angelos K. Marnerides, Vasileios Giotsas, Troy Mursch ðŸ“• IEEE GLOBECOM 2019 ðŸ“„ Full paper Internet-wide security and resilience have traditionally been subject to large-scale DDoS attacks initiated by various types of botnets. Since the Mirai outbreak in 2016 myriads of Mirai-alike IoT-based botnets have emerged. Such botnets rely on Miraiâ€™s base malware code and they infiltrate vulnerable IoT devices on an Internet-wide scale such as to instrument them to perform large-scale attacks such as DDoS.
